metadata.title: CVE-2019-9790 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when a raw pointer to a DOMelement on a page is obtained using JavaScript and the element is thenremoved while still in use. This results in a potentially exploitablecrash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.6, Firefox ESR < 60.6,and Firefox < 66.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
